Metadata.Title: Ensure that the --anonymous-auth argument is set to false
Metadata.Description: Disable anonymous requests to the API server.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the --token-auth-file parameter is not set
Metadata.Description: Do not use token based authentication.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the --DenyServiceExternalIPs is not set
Metadata.Description: This admission controller rejects all net-new usage of the Service field externalIPs.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the --kubelet-https argument is set to true
Metadata.Description: Use https for kubelet connections.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the --kubelet-client-certificate and --kubelet-client-key arguments are set as appropriate
Metadata.Description: Enable certificate based kubelet authentication.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the --kubelet-certificate-authority argument is set as appropriate
Metadata.Description: Verify kubelet's certificate before establishing connection.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the --authorization-mode argument is not set to AlwaysAllow
Metadata.Description: Do not always authorize all requests.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the --authorization-mode argument includes Node
Metadata.Description: Restrict kubelet nodes to reading only objects associated with them.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the --authorization-mode argument includes RBAC
Metadata.Description: Turn on Role Based Access Control.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the admission control plugin EventRateLimit is set
Metadata.Description: Limit the rate at which the API server accepts requests.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the admission control plugin AlwaysAdmit is not set
Metadata.Description: Do not allow all requests.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the admission control plugin SecurityContextDeny is set if PodSecurityPolicy is not used
Metadata.Description: The SecurityContextDeny admission controller can be used to deny pods which make use of some SecurityContext fields which could allow for privilege escalation in the cluster. This should be used where PodSecurityPolicy is not in place within the cluster.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the admission control plugin ServiceAccount is set
Metadata.Description: Automate service accounts management.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the admission control plugin NamespaceLifecycle is set
Metadata.Description: Reject creating objects in a namespace that is undergoing termination.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the admission control plugin NodeRestriction is set
Metadata.Description: Limit the Node and Pod objects that a kubelet could modify.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the --secure-port argument is not set to 0
Metadata.Description: Do not disable the secure port.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the --profiling argument is set to false
Metadata.Description: Disable profiling, if not needed.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the --audit-log-path argument is set
Metadata.Description: Enable auditing on the Kubernetes API Server and set the desired audit log path.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the --audit-log-maxage argument is set to 30 or as appropriate
Metadata.Description: Retain the logs for at least 30 days or as appropriate.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the --audit-log-maxbackup argument is set to 10 or as appropriate
Metadata.Description: Retain 10 or an appropriate number of old log files.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the --audit-log-maxsize argument is set to 100 or as appropriate
Metadata.Description: Rotate log files on reaching 100 MB or as appropriate.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the --service-account-lookup argument is set to true
Metadata.Description: Validate service account before validating token.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the --service-account-key-file argument is set as appropriate
Metadata.Description: Explicitly set a service account public key file for service accounts on the apiserver.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the --etcd-certfile and --etcd-keyfile arguments are set as appropriate
Metadata.Description: etcd should be configured to make use of TLS encryption for client connections.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the --tls-cert-file and --tls-private-key-file arguments are set as appropriate
Metadata.Description: Setup TLS connection on the API server.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the --client-ca-file argument is set as appropriate
Metadata.Description: Setup TLS connection on the API server.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the --etcd-cafile argument is set as appropriate
Metadata.Description: etcd should be configured to make use of TLS encryption for client connections.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the --encryption-provider-config argument is set as appropriate
Metadata.Description: Encrypt etcd key-value store.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the --terminated-pod-gc-threshold argument is set as appropriate
Metadata.Description: Activate garbage collector on pod termination, as appropriate.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the --profiling argument is set to false
Metadata.Description: Disable profiling, if not needed.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the --service-account-private-key-file argument is set as appropriate
Metadata.Description: Explicitly set a service account private key file for service accounts on the controller manager.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the --root-ca-file argument is set as appropriate
Metadata.Description: Allow pods to verify the API server's serving certificate before establishing connections.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the RotateKubeletServerCertificate argument is set to true
Metadata.Description: Enable kubelet server certificate rotation on controller-manager.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the --bind-address argument is set to 127.0.0.1
Metadata.Description: Do not bind the scheduler service to non-loopback insecure addresses.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the --profiling argument is set to false
Metadata.Description: Disable profiling, if not needed.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the --bind-address argument is set to 127.0.0.1
Metadata.Description: Do not bind the scheduler service to non-loopback insecure addresses.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the --cert-file and --key-file arguments are set as appropriate
Metadata.Description: Configure TLS encryption for the etcd service.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the --client-cert-auth argument is set to true
Metadata.Description: Enable client authentication on etcd service.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the --auto-tls argument is not set to true
Metadata.Description: Do not use self-signed certificates for TLS.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the --peer-cert-file and --peer-key-file arguments are set as appropriate
Metadata.Description: etcd should be configured to make use of TLS encryption for peer connections.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the --peer-client-cert-auth argument is set to true
Metadata.Description: etcd should be configured for peer authentication.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the --peer-auto-tls argument is not set to true
Metadata.Description: Do not use self-signed certificates for TLS.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the --use-service-account-credentials argument is set to true
Metadata.Description: Use individual service account credentials for each controller.

Metadata.Title: Process can elevate its own privileges
Metadata.Description: A program inside the container can elevate its own privileges and run as root, which might give the program control over the container and node.

Metadata.Title: Ensure that the admission control plugin AlwaysPullImages is set
Metadata.Description: Always pull images.

Metadata.Title: Default AppArmor profile not set
Metadata.Description: A program inside the container can bypass AppArmor protection policies.

Metadata.Title: Default capabilities not dropped
Metadata.Description: The container should drop all default capabilities and add only those that are needed for its execution.

Metadata.Title: SYS_ADMIN capability added
Metadata.Description: SYS_ADMIN gives the processes running inside the container privileges that are equivalent to root.

Metadata.Title: hostPath volume mounted with docker.sock
Metadata.Description: Mounting docker.sock from the host can give the container full root access to the host.

Metadata.Title: Access to host IPC namespace
Metadata.Description: Sharing the host’s IPC namespace allows container processes to communicate with processes on the host.

Metadata.Title: Access to host network
Metadata.Description: Sharing the host’s network namespace permits processes in the pod to communicate with processes bound to the host’s loopback adapter.

Metadata.Title: Access to host PID
Metadata.Description: Sharing the host’s PID namespace allows visibility on host processes, potentially leaking information such as environment variables and configuration.

Metadata.Title: CPU not limited
Metadata.Description: Enforcing CPU limits prevents DoS via resource exhaustion.

Metadata.Title: Runs as root user
Metadata.Description: 'runAsNonRoot' forces the running image to run as a non-root user to ensure least privileges.

Metadata.Title: Image tag ':latest' used
Metadata.Description: It is best to avoid using the ':latest' image tag when deploying containers in production. Doing so makes it hard to track which version of the image is running, and hard to roll back the version.

Metadata.Title: Root file system is not read-only
Metadata.Description: An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk.

Metadata.Title: CPU requests not specified
Metadata.Description: When containers have resource requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention.

Metadata.Title: Memory requests not specified
Metadata.Description: When containers have memory requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention.

Metadata.Title: Privileged container
Metadata.Description: Privileged containers share namespaces with the host system and do not offer any security. They should be used exclusively for system containers that require high privileges.

Metadata.Title: Memory not limited
Metadata.Description: Enforcing memory limits prevents DoS via resource exhaustion.

Metadata.Title: Runs with low user ID
Metadata.Description: Force the container to run with user ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the host’s user table.

Metadata.Title: Runs with low group ID
Metadata.Description: Force the container to run with group ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the host’s user table.

Metadata.Title: Non-default capabilities added
Metadata.Description: Adding NET_RAW or capabilities beyond the default set must be disallowed.

Metadata.Title: hostPath volumes mounted
Metadata.Description: HostPath volumes must be forbidden.

Metadata.Title: Access to host ports
Metadata.Description: HostPorts should be disallowed, or at minimum restricted to a known list.

Metadata.Title: SELinux custom options set
Metadata.Description: Setting a custom SELinux user or role option should be forbidden.

Metadata.Title: Unsafe sysctl options set
Metadata.Description: Sysctls can disable security mechanisms or affect all containers on a host, and should be disallowed except for an allowed 'safe' subset. A sysctl is considered safe if it is namespaced in the container or the Pod, and it is isolated from other Pods or processes on the same Node.

Metadata.Title: Non-default /proc masks set
Metadata.Description: The default /proc masks are set up to reduce attack surface, and should be required.

Metadata.Title: Non-ephemeral volume types used
Metadata.Description: In addition to restricting HostPath volumes, usage of non-ephemeral volume types should be limited to those defined through PersistentVolumes.

Metadata.Title: Default Seccomp profile not set
Metadata.Description: The RuntimeDefault/Localhost seccomp profile must be required, or allow specific additional profiles.

Messages: Either Pod or Container should set 'securityContext.seccompProfile.type' to 'RuntimeDefault'

Metadata.Title: Protecting Pod service account tokens
Metadata.Description: ensure that Pod specifications disable the secret token being mounted by setting automountServiceAccountToken: false

Metadata.Title: User Pods should not be placed in kube-system namespace
Metadata.Description: ensure that User pods are not placed in kube-system namespace

Metadata.Title: Selector usage in network policies
Metadata.Description: ensure that network policies selectors are applied to pods or namespaces to restricted ingress and egress traffic within the pod network

Metadata.Title: Tiller Is Deployed
Metadata.Description: Check if Helm Tiller component is deployed.

Metadata.Title: HostProcess container defined
Metadata.Description: Windows pods offer the ability to run HostProcess containers which enable privileged access to the Windows node.

Metadata.Title: Seccomp profile unconfined
Metadata.Description: Seccomp profile must not be explicitly set to 'Unconfined'.

Metadata.Title: Containers must not set runAsUser to 0
Metadata.Description: Containers should be forbidden from running with a root UID.

Metadata.Title: Container capabilities must only include NET_BIND_SERVICE
Metadata.Description: Containers must drop ALL capabilities, and are only permitted to add back the NET_BIND_SERVICE capability.

Metadata.Title: N/A
Metadata.Description: Rego module: data.defsec.kubernetes.KSV107
